episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics including the origin of the Doomsday Clock's initial setting, villagers in the Central African Republic who coexist with lions to scavenge their kills, a Victorian time capsule in London containing photos of the era's beauties, and the self-cleaning process of women's breasts after breastfeeding.

facts.fact: The Doomsday Clock was originally set at seven minutes to midnight because the artist responsible for it thought it looked good.
Some villagers in the Central African Republic deliberately allow lions to live nearby so they can steal their food.
There is a Victorian time capsule buried in London that contains photographs of the 12 best looking women in England.
After women stop breastfeeding, their breasts eat themselves.
